data.text: How to Get a Tourist Visa for Bike Touring Through Iran and Pakistan?

Hi everyone! I have a question to those who have travelled throuhg Iran and Pakistan. What type of visas did you get and how? What I find that a regular tourist visa for Iran is for 14 days - that is just to dip one wheel into the country not to go through it. How did you managed this? would highly appreciate any tips. :D
Cycling through Iran west east one month minimum
data.author: Datt Bharti Horst

data.text:
Hey! Got a 1 month standard visa for Iran at the embassy in Istanbul. This we renewed very easily 2 times while in Iran (so we stayed 3 months in total) and the Pakistan visa we did online and renewed it there once. More info on our website Www.421adventure.com and don't hesitate to ask further details 😁
4 wheels 2 hearts 1 world
421adventure.com
data.author: Doc Marco

data.text: your website is incredible! How to extend the visa? I am so new at all these things. I have traveled mostly in EU or countries where no visa is required.
data.author: Agnese Vaļka

data.text:
thanks!!!! ☺️ In Iran is super easy; there's immigration offices in every major city and you just go there, pay a few euros and get an extension, same in Pakistan. By the way, you'll def need to check out caravanistan.com ... It'll be your best friend all through Asia 😉
The Silk Road Travel Guide | Caravanistan
caravanistan.com
data.author: Doc Marco

data.text: Fantastic! Thank you so much for help! :D
data.author: Agnese Vaļka

data.text: What passport do you have? Got 45 days, German. Check the group https://facebook.com/groups/1483860975268043/?ref=share

data.text: 15 days for Iran? Got a month in Dubai easily and extended, 2 months in total. Polish

data.text: How did you extend the visa? was it electronically or you had to go somewhere?
data.author: Agnese Vaļka

data.text: for visa extention you do in person As far as I remember some cities are better than others You would need to google it. Caravanistan forum was helpful too

data.text:
I was recommended a visa through tappersia.com several times, I'm in the process of figuring everything out. The experiences of the others (that I asked) are consistently positive
Travel to Iran like a local: Custom tour & 24/7 Live assistance - TAP Persia
tappersia.com
data.author: Mona Merk

data.text: It is worth remembering that the visa condition for any country can often depend on your home country/passport. It may also depend on other country entry stamps in your passport. In other words, answers may vary.
data.author: Mark Perry
